com.demandware.appsec.secure.manipulation

Class SecureFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.demandware.appsec.secure.manipulation.SecureFilter

  • public class SecureFilter
extends Object
    SecureFilter contains many methods for manipulating untrusted data Strings into RFC-Compliant Strings for a given context by removing "bad" data from the untrusted data.
    Author:
    Chris Smith

        Shared method to handle filter lookup by type and dispatch string
        Parameters:
        type - the manipulation type to use for filter lookup
        input - the string to filter
        Returns:
        a properly encoded string representation of the input string

      • filter

        public static void filter(IManipulationType type,
                          String input,
                          Writer writer)
        Shared method to handle filter lookup by type and dispatch string to be written with the given writer
        Parameters:
        type - the manipulation type to use for filter lookup
        input - the string to filter
        writer - a Writer to write output to

      • filterHtmlContent

        public static String filterHtmlContent(String input)

        Filters illegal characters from a given input for use in a general HTML context. E.g. text content and text attributes. This method takes the UNION of allowed characters among all contexts, so may be more imprecise than the more specific contexts. Generally, this method is preferred unless you specifically understand the context in which untrusted data will be displayed.

        Example Usage: 
         <div>${SecureFilter.filterHtmlContent(unsafeData)}</div>

 <input value="${SecureFilter.filterHtmlContent(unsafeData)}" />
        Flow:
        • Allow AlphaNumerics and some Special characters
        • Remove all other characters
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        Returns:
        a properly filtered string for the given input, or null if the input is null

      • filterHtmlContent

        public static void filterHtmlContent(String input,
                                     Writer out)
        Writes filtered content directly to given java.io.Writer See filterHtmlContent(String)
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        out - where to write the filtered output

      • filterHtmlInSingleQuoteAttribute

        public static String filterHtmlInSingleQuoteAttribute(String input)

        Filters illegal characters from a given input for use in an HTML Attribute guarded by a single quote. This method is preferred if you understand exactly how the output of this will be used in the HTML document.

        Example Usage: 
         <div id='${SecureFilter.filterHtmlInSingleQuoteAttribute(unsafeData)}'></div>
        Flow:
        • Allow AlphaNumerics and some Special characters
        • Remove all other characters
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filterd, if necessary
        Returns:
        a properly filtered string for the given input, or null if the input is null

      • filterJavaScriptInHTML

        public static String filterJavaScriptInHTML(String input)

        Filters illegal characters from a given input for use in JavaScript inside an HTML context. This method takes the UNION of allowed characters among the other contexts, so may be more imprecise than the more specific contexts. Generally, this method is preferred unless you specifically understand the context in which untrusted data will be displayed.

        Example Usage: 
         <script type="text/javascript">
     var data = "${SecureFilter.filterJavaScriptInHTML(unsafeData)}";
 </script>

 <button onclick="alert('${SecureFilter.filterJavaScriptInHTML(unsafeData)}');">
        Flow:
        • Allow AlphaNumerics and some Special characters
        • Remove all other characters
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        Returns:
        a properly filtered string for the given input, or null if the input is null

      • filterJavaScriptInHTML

        public static void filterJavaScriptInHTML(String input,
                                          Writer out)
        Writes filtered content directly to given java.io.Writer See filterJavaScriptInHTML(String)
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        out - where to write the filtered output

      • filterJavaScriptInAttribute

        public static String filterJavaScriptInAttribute(String input)

        Filters illegal characters from a given input for use in JavaScript inside an HTML attribute. This method is preferred if you understand exactly how the output of this will be used in the page

        Example Usage: 
         <button onclick="alert('${SecureFilter.filterJavaScriptInAttribute(unsafeData)}');">
        Flow:
        • Allow AlphaNumerics and some Special characters
        • Remove all other characters
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        Returns:
        a properly filtered string for the given input, or null if the input is null

      • filterJavaScriptInSource

        public static String filterJavaScriptInSource(String input)

        Filters illegal characters from a given input for use in JavaScript inside a JavaScript source file. This method is preferred if you understand exactly how the output of this will be used in the page

        Example Usage: 
         <...inside foobar.js...>
 var data = "${SecureFilter.filterJavaScriptInSource(unsafeData)}";
        Flow:
        • Allow AlphaNumerics and some Special characters
        • Remove all other characters
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        Returns:
        a properly filtered string for the given input, or null if the input is null

      • filterJSONValue

        public static String filterJSONValue(String input)

        Filters illegal characters from a given input for use in a JSON Object Value to prevent escaping into a trusted context.

        Example Usage: 
         var json = {"trusted_data" : SecureFilter.filterJSONValue(unsafeData)};
 return JSON.stringify(json);
        Flow:
        • Allow AlphaNumerics
        • Remove all other characters
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        Returns:
        a properly filtered string for the given input, or null if the input is null

      • filterJSONValue

        public static void filterJSONValue(String input,
                                   Writer out)
        Writes filtered content directly to given java.io.Writer See filterJSONValue(String)
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        out - where to write the filtered output

      • filterUriComponent

        public static String filterUriComponent(String input)

        Filters illegal characters from a given input for use as a component of a URI. This is equivalent to javascript's filterURIComponent and does a realistic job of encoding.

        Example Usage: 
         <a href="http://host.com?value=${SecureFilter.filterUriComponent(unsafeData)}"/>
        Allows: 
         A-Z, a-z, 0-9, -, _, ., ~, !, *, ', (, )
        Flow:
        • Allow AlphaNumerics and some Special characters
        • Remove all other characters
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        Returns:
        a properly filtered string for the given input, or null if the input is null

      • filterUriComponent

        public static void filterUriComponent(String input,
                                      Writer out)
        Writes filtered content directly to given java.io.Writer See filterUriComponent(String)
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        out - where to write the filtered output

      • filterUriComponentStrict

        public static String filterUriComponentStrict(String input)

        Filters illegal characters from a given input for use as a component of a URI. This is a strict filter and fully complies with RFC3986.

        Example Usage: 
         <a href="http://host.com?value=${SecureFilter.filterUriComponentStrict(unsafeData)}"/>
        Allows: 
         A-Z, a-z, 0-9, -, _, ., ~
        Flow:
        • Allow AlphaNumerics and some Special characters
        • Remove all other characters
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        Returns:
        a properly filtered string for the given input, or null if the input is null

      • filterUriComponentStrict

        public static void filterUriComponentStrict(String input,
                                            Writer out)
        Writes filtered content directly to given java.io.Writer See filterUriComponentStrict(String)
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        out - where to write the filtered output

      • filterXmlContent

        public static String filterXmlContent(String input)

        Filters illegal characters from a given input for use in a general XML context. E.g. text content and text attributes. This method takes the UNION of allowed characters between the other contexts, so may be more imprecise than the more specific contexts. Generally, this method is preferred unless you specifically understand the context in which untrusted data will be displayed.

        Note: It is recommended that you use a real parser, as this method can be misused, but is left here if a parser is unavailable to you
        Example Usage: 
         <foo>${SecureFilter.filterXmlContent(unsafeData)}</foo>

 <bar attr="${SecureFilter.filterXmlContent(unsafeData)}"></bar>
        Flow:
        • Allow AlphaNumerics and some Special characters
        • Remove all other characters
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        Returns:
        a properly filtered string for the given input, or null if the input is null

      • filterXmlContent

        public static void filterXmlContent(String input,
                                    Writer out)
        Writes filtered content directly to given java.io.Writer See filterXmlContent(String)
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        out - where to write the filtered output

        public static String filterXmlInSingleQuoteAttribute(String input)

      • filterXmlCommentContent

        public static String filterXmlCommentContent(String input)

        Filters illegal characters from a given input for use in an XML comments. This method is preferred if you understand the context in which untrusted data will be displayed.

        Note: It is recommended that you use a real parser, as this method can be misused, but is left here if a parser is unavailable to you
        Example Usage: 
         <!-- ${SecureFilter.filterXmlCommentContent(unsafeData)} -->
        Flow:
        • Allow AlphaNumerics and some Special characters
        • Remove all other characters
        Parameters:
        input - untrusted input to be filtered, if necessary
        Returns:
        a properly filtered string for the given input, or null if the input is null
